Question
column3: Answer

session_1747328596206_twpxhv4: To what extent do you support or oppose the widespread deployment of surveillance cameras in public spaces? Please explain your reasoning.
column3: I oppose it as there is a lot or racial and gender bias.

session_1747328596206_twpxhv4: What do you think are the most significant impacts, positive or negative, of increasing surveillance camera coverage in urban areas?
column3: I don't think there are any impacts. It seems any time surveillance cameras are used, the perpetrator is blurry or not visible. So it makes no difference. Then when a crime happens the police can somehow never find the perp.

session_1747328596206_twpxhv4: How do you think surveillance technologies might affect public safety and crime rates?
column3: I don't think it makes a difference in crime rates or public safety

session_1747328596206_twpxhv4: What impact do you believe increased surveillance might have on personal privacy and individual liberties?
column3: People will want to go out less.

session_1747328596206_twpxhv4: How do you think surveillance camera systems might affect community trust and police-community relations?
column3: I think it will make it worse as police are already seen as being widely ineffective and too brutal when they shouldn't be.

session_1747328596206_twpxhv4: What role do you believe government should play in regulating surveillance technologies and data collection?
column3: I think it needs to stay out of it

session_1747328596206_twpxhv4: How might technological concerns about accuracy and reliability factor into decisions about surveillance systems?
column3: It will dissuade people with good intentions but it would not deter lawmakers or city officials as they have already enacted lots of surveillance in certain areas.

session_1747328596206_twpxhv4: What economic effects, both positive and negative, might result from investing in widespread surveillance infrastructure?
column3: I do not know.

session_1747328596206_twpxhv4: How do you think the interests of law enforcement versus privacy advocates should be balanced when making surveillance policy?
column3: I think privacy advocates should carry more weight. There is too much police brutality and overreach and they cannot be trusted to have the public's best interest at hand.

session_1747328596206_twpxhv4: What role do you think social equity and potential bias play in discussions about surveillance technologies?
column3: I think minorities and organization for minorities see there is a lot of potential for bias. Others (police, city, officials, etc) will not care.

session_1747328596206_twpxhv4: Does Racial bias have a positive or negative effect on Support for surveillance camera, and how significant is this effect? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: Very negative strong effect. It will lead to more imprisonments without due process simply because you were caught on tape at the scene of a crime at the time surrounding a crime.

session_1747328596206_twpxhv4: What causes changes in Support for surveillance camera? Are these influences strong or weak?
column3: I don't think people's support changes. I think most people have their mind made up.

session_1747328596206_twpxhv4: Does Crime solving capabilities of police have a positive or negative effect on Support for surveillance camera, and how significant is this effect? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: I don't know whether it is a factor but it should not. Police are highly ineffective even when they have evidence.

session_1747328596206_twpxhv4: How confident are you that changes in Community trust lead to changes in Support for surveillance camera? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: I think community trust can play a difference depending on how big or small the community is.

session_1747328596206_twpxhv4: Does Surveillance Technologies have a positive or negative effect on Support for surveillance camera, and how significant is this effect? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: They probably have a positive effect as these companies with the technologies want to be able to use them and win contracts from local governments to profit off of them.

session_1747328596206_twpxhv4: Would small changes in People with good intentions lead to noticeable changes in Support for surveillance camera, or would it take larger shifts? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: I don't it would change anything

session_1747328596206_twpxhv4: Would small changes in Privacy Advocates lead to noticeable changes in Support for surveillance camera, or would it take larger shifts? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: It would take larger shifts to help privacy advocates have a chance as the government and these technology companies want to exploit our privacy and they have tons of money to be able to get it done.

session_1747328596206_twpxhv4: How confident are you that changes in Trust in Law Enforcement lead to changes in Support for surveillance camera? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: Very confident. I have seen how ineffective the police are in my city and it greatly has diminished my support for surveillance. I do not trust them with more information.

session_1747328596206_twpxhv4: How confident are you that changes in City officials lead to changes in Support for surveillance camera? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: Very confident. I have seen how ineffective local government can be and it greatly has diminished my support for surveillance. I do not trust them with more information.

session_1747328596206_twpxhv4: How would you describe the relationship between Potential Bias and Support for surveillance camera? Is it a strong or weak connection? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: The potential of bias creates a very negative effect and it is a very strong connection

column3: It is immediate as most people in the community already have a perception of local law enforcement and their actions

column3: Weak connection as I do not know of any data that would support the need for survelliance.

column3: Exploitation of privacy has a negative effect as it makes people feel like targets even when they should not be.
